titles.ar: بَابُ كَرَاهَةِ أَنْ يُؤْخَذَ مِنْ تُرَابِ الْبَيْتِ وَ حَصَاهُ
titles.en: Chapter 17 – Abhorrence of taking from the soil of the House (Kabah) and its pebbles
Chapter 18 – Abhorrence of staying in Makkah
Chapter 16 – Wearing the clothing of the Kabah

titles.ar: بَابُ كَرَاهَةِ أَنْ يُؤْخَذَ مِنْ تُرَابِ الْبَيْتِ وَ حَصَاهُ
titles.en: Chapter 17 – Abhorrence of taking from the soil of the House (Kabah) and its pebbles

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/78)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ النُّعْمَانِ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ الْخَزَّازِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ لَا يَنْبَغِي لِأَحَدٍ أَنْ يَأْخُذَ مِنْ تُرْبَةِ مَا حَوْلَ الْكَعْبَةِ وَ إِنْ أَخَذَ مِنْ ذَلِكَ شَيْئاً رَدَّهُ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Dawood Bin Al Numan, from Abu Ayoub Al Khazaz, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said,
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘It is not befitting for anyone that he take from the soil of what is around the Kabah. And if he does take anything from that, he should return it’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam, from Dawud ibn al-Nu’man from abu Ayyub al-Khazzaz from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “I once heard abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, say, ‘It is not proper to take soil from around al- Ka‘bah, and if one does so he must return it back.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/79)

parts.text: أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ عَنِ الْمُفَضَّلِ بْنِ صَالِحٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَخَذْتُ سُكّاً مِنْ سُكِّ الْمَقَامِ وَ تُرَاباً مِنْ تُرَابِ الْبَيْتِ وَ سَبْعَ حَصَيَاتٍ فَقَالَ بِئْسَ مَا صَنَعْتَ أَمَّا التُّرَابُ وَ الْحَصَى فَرُدَّهُ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Abu Nasr, from Al Mufazzal Bin Salih, from Muawiya Bin Ammar who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>: ‘I have taken a perfume from the perfumes of the Standing Place (of Ibrahim<sup>as</sup>, and soil from the soils of the House (Kabah), and seven pebbles’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Evil is what you have done. As for the soil and the pebbles, so return it’.
en.sarwar: 2. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn abu Nasr from al-Mufaddal ibn Salih from Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “I once said to abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, that I have taken of the perfumes of al-Maqam (station of Ibrahim) and soil from the soil of al-Bayt (the House) and the seven pebbles. He (the Imam) said, ‘How bad is what you have done! However, you must return the soil and pebbles.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/79)

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مِهْرَانَ عَمَّنْ حَدَّثَهُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ حُذَيْفَةَ بْنِ مَنْصُورٍ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّ عَمِّي كَنَسَ الْكَعْبَةَ وَ أَخَذَ مِنْ تُرَابِهَا فَنَحْنُ نَتَدَاوَى بِهِ فَقَالَ رُدَّهُ إِلَيْهَا .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Mihran, from the one who narrates it, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Huzeyfa Bin Mansour who said,
‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> that my uncle is a sweeper of the Kabah and took from its soil. So we tend to heal by it. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Return it back to it’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ahmad ibn Mehran has narrated from Muhammad ibn Sinan from Hudhayfah ibn Mansur who has said the following: “I once said to abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, that my uncle once swept al-Ka‘bah and took of the dust and we use it as medicine. He (the Imam) said, ‘You must return it back.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل كالموثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/79)

narrator_chain.text: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ غَيْرِ وَاحِدٍ عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَنْ زَيْدٍ الشَّحَّامِ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَخْرُجُ مِنَ الْمَسْجِدِ وَ فِي ثَوْبِي حَصَاةٌ قَالَ فَرُدَّهَا أَوِ اطْرَحْهَا فِي مَسْجِدٍ .

en.hubeali: Humeyd Bin Ziyad, from Ibn Sama’at, from someone else, from Aban, from Ziyad Al Shahaam who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘I went out from the (Sacred) Masjid and in my clothes were pebbles (taken from the Sacred Masjid)’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘So either return it, or throw it back into the Masjid’.
en.sarwar: 4. Humayd ibn Ziyad has narrated from ibn Sama‘ah and from more than one person from Aban from Zayd al-Shahham who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the pebbles that I find with me after coming out of the Masjid. He (the Imam) said, ‘Return them or throw in the Masjid.’”
